website_summaries.verdict: A highly effective solution for at-home users who want to process meat in bulk. The best on the market.
pros: Professional-grade performance at a home-appliance price point
Easy to take apart and clean
cons: 7" blade is smaller than some other slicers (but still incredibly effective)

customer_reviews.title: 615 vs 615A
customer_reviews.text: The only difference between the 615 and 615A per a call with the Chef's Choice, today, is that the 615A is made by a different supplier. To distinguish between the two, the serial number label has a date code on it. This code next to the serial number starts with a Letter. The first one I ordered was A18, which indicates January 2018 and would not be the 615A model. The 615A model should have a date code of D18 or greater. D meaning April and 18 meaning 2018. I sent the first one back and awaiting the second one. Chef's Choice Customer Service and Amazon representatives were fantastic in sorting this out.
customer_reviews.author: The Hausmans

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cut the cheese; Literally...
customer_reviews.text: I got this to slice some pretty basic things... pork belly for bacon, pork loin for sandwiches, and cheese. The unit simply doesn't have any power and cannot slice cheese without dying with a blown fuse regardless of care of feed rate. The blade spins slower than a ceiling fan on low at full speed and has pretty much no power. I waited too long to return it, so now I'm going to contact the manufacturer to see what they will do for me. Will report back here when I have more info on whether they care and take care of me.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Dorman

customer_reviews.title: Does not slice Prosciutto or Tirolean Speck thin enough
customer_reviews.text: It might cut other things very well but does not work as expected for my purpose. (cutting Prosciutto and/or Tirolean Speck) Therefor I gave it only a 3 rating. Also, especially for my purpose I would like to see a suction feature of the unit to the granite counter. When pushing the meat thru the slicer it wanders all over the place which makes it hard yo cut. It also potentially could be unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: Bernd S. Mieth

customer_reviews.title: not correct discription
customer_reviews.text: wanted same meat slicer as last time, this was described as an up to date version and cost more than twice the amount. opened the box and found that the product was exactly the same as before
customer_reviews.author: emma

customer_reviews.title: Defective as fuse blew out on first use and then the replacement fuse blew out. Defective
customer_reviews.text: I waited too long to use it as the the refund window has closed. Just to warn others to test it when received. Ours blew a fuse at first use trying to cut some soft ham. I saw they included a replacement fuse in the box and then replaced it hoping it was just a bad fuse. That immediately blew too. So basically I have a product that I never used and will need to trash. Hope the others aren't like mine but again suggest you immediately try it so if it's defective you are in the refund window.
customer_reviews.author: tmurphy

customer_reviews.title: Food slicer works very well
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews regarding machines with less wattage, I opted for the 615A - which has 120 watts. I have sliced beef, chicken, vegetables with no problem. This is a very good light duty machine for home use. It probably could be used for light commercial for a limited time - perhaps. The sliding carriage which holds the meat has an approximate dimension of about 6" x 6".x 6" Therefore, cut large pieces of meat to fit safely on the carriage. Also, as others have mentioned - chilled meats can be cut much more uniformly.
customer_reviews.author: JayPee

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had a few meat slicers but this one is by far the best. Surprisingly pretty quiet and cuts the same slice each time. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Ok while it lasted, kind of a pain to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Meat slicer was great while it lasted, which was just under 2 years. For the price I would have expected it to last a little longer with such occasional use. We would pull it out once a month, so literally less than 24 uses and the plastic gears stripped. We did NOT abuse it, we followed the directions to a T. Was great while it lasted, cut well, was a nightmare to clean. Could never get everything out of the seams behind the blade. Photo is what lies behind the blade, which is where all the crap gets stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Impressive -- big step up from most home slicers.
customer_reviews.text: This is not commercial grade obviously but it's a significant improvement over the entry level home slicers. It can go through a few pounds of meat without overheating. I've done continuous slicing for about 15-20 minutes without problems. The motor has ventilation fan so that probably helps. (there is a fuse that will protect the motor if it does overheat -- and they give you an extra fuse) The design is lightweight and compact but it's metal in the right places. The guide plate is rigid so it can do consistent paper-thin slices (you need to buy the thin blade for this). And maybe most importantly, it's been designed for relatively fast cleaning. Removing the blade requires a coin.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B

customer_reviews.title: Great But Bad
customer_reviews.text: The slicer itself is wonderful. The reason for the 1 star rating is that the unit's fuse blew out on the fifth use, and the replacement fuse that came with the unit was bad and did not work. Up until then, the machine worked as advertised. Great for slicing meats and cheese. I like how thin I can slice my roasts, turkey, chicken breasts and various cheeses. The problem is that when ordering replacement fuses, the Chef's Choice site failed to send them. It has been three weeks and nothing. I had to find them from another source and it was just frustrating. Machine great; Customer service terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Eusal5

customer_reviews.title: Professional slicer right at home
customer_reviews.text: I use my Chef’s Choice slicer to make jerky, to slice my homemade breads, homemade roast meats paper thin like at the deli, cheese blocks and even tomatoes for sandwiches/caprese, cucumbers to pickle or apples to dehydrate. It works beautifully and is easy to disassemble for cleaning. You have to stock a couple of different greases; the instruction booklet very clearly explains maintenance requirements, which are low. This machine takes up quite a bit of real estate in my kitchen, but is so cool looking that I don’t mind leaving it out on the counter permanently. My new best friend.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia Romero

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste you time or money😼
customer_reviews.text: Does not slice bread without breaking it apart. Does not cleanly slice meat! Returned Didn’t know it was sold by woot otherwise I would never of bought it! Any thing I ever bought from them I had to return😼
customer_reviews.author: peter a murner

customer_reviews.title: Be aware the 609-A is the same as the 609 ...
customer_reviews.text: Be aware the 609-A is the same as the 609. Someone stuck an "A" sticker on the box. The actual unit does not say 609A but just 609. I do not see anything stainless except the blade and the 609 is also stainless blade.
customer_reviews.author: E S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lunch meat and more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product based on the reviews and have been very happy with it. We buy some of our meats in bulk and slice them when we get home. This slicer has worked out great. My husband likes it so much he does all the slicing. He says it is super easy to clean and use he wishes we would have purchased it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: paper thin slices
customer_reviews.text: Set it up, plugged it in and sliced part of a bone in ham. The slicer made almost paper this slices. I think it would slice thinner but the ham wouldn't be intact. I can put my fingers behind the slice and see shadows. I can't wait to try it out with a home made pastrami. I think I can get it as thin as in NYC. So far very pleased. Got to be careful handling the blade when cleaning. I've got an oyster glove I'm going to use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barker

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this slicer.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice slicer. You can cut the cheese (so to speak) so thin you see thru it. Slicing frozen zucchini bread is easy. Cleanup is easy and the machine is well built.
customer_reviews.author: rw80227

customer_reviews.title: Blew a fuse
customer_reviews.text: I like the slicer for it safety features and it easy clean up, but what I don't like is its inability to take a power load. I was slicing cheddar cheese for the first time and the built in small appliance fuse popped rendering the unit useless. I replaced to fuse with the extra one provided by the manufacture and proceeded to slice my cheese block, but this time ever so cautiously as not to pop my last replacement fuse. So what happens? A piece of cheese found its way between the tray and the blade. Before I could stop it bound the blade and popped the second fuse. Out of business, not good and not happy. Frank
customer_reviews.author: Frank Harshman Sr

customer_reviews.title: Does a Good Job
customer_reviews.text: This thing slices through solid/frozen foods with ease. The clean up is a little bit of trouble and it needs to be oiled each time. The non-slip feet DO slide on our granite counters but does 100 times better than our old slicer. I would recommend this to others that slice a lot of things for future use or for immediate use. The thinner slices are great for dehydrating meats and treats for my dogs..........gobble, gobble!
customer_reviews.author: Brat1111

customer_reviews.title: a little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at full price, not used price. It had been used and you knew it. There is a little fuse or whatever in it and it had burned out but you knew this because you put a spare new on in the package. The slot where you adjust depth had been worn so it wasn't a perfect slot to be able to adjust meat thickness. this was a gift for my son. He really likes it but I am disappointed with you all. Be up front and honest about things
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty slow and kinda of poor quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would be a nice quality. Unfortunately the blade spins pretty slow and it actually crumbled the cheese if I didn't watch it closely. The plate to catch the stuff was pretty small as well. Overall it was OK but I can't say it was worth the price I paid. I could have gotten a much cheaper one and it would have been equivalent to this one.
customer_reviews.author: KlamathLiz

customer_reviews.title: Good for home use
customer_reviews.text: Does an excellent job slicing a roast with the non-serrated blade. Haven't used the serrated blade but it looks good for cutting crusty loaves for dinner parties. Clean up is what you'd expect and there is some minimal waste from meat getting caught in the corner but not enough to worry about. Buy the kevlar or other safety "cut-proof" gloves which makes removing and handling the blade for clean up a lot safer and much easier. I've had the slicer for several months, cut up a large 15 pound roast with no difficulty and much easier, faster, and better looking slices than cutting by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Stay AWAY from this Product
customer_reviews.text: This slicer was not with the box it was shipped in. Immediately after opening I tried to use this slicer and it blew the fuse, stated smoking and quit working. Called the company, sent the unit back to the given location and now almost 60 days have passed and I have had zero communication, have no slicer and zero service. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Lil machine ....
customer_reviews.text: Great Lil machine; sliced up 7 eggplants in just minutes; also sliced up Italian cooked sausage paper thin for my Lasagna .... Sliced up a large Spanish onion paper thin ... The motor is loud so expect that.... clean up was easy but takes a lil time .... Can’t wait to try this on my Eye round roast beefs & loin of pork roasts !!! Blade is very sharp so handle with care .....
customer_reviews.author: Greg D.

customer_reviews.title: Save time and money and use this slicer!
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of going to the deli and waiting on line for cold cuts. The pre-cut stuff was either too thick or too thin. I bought this slicer and saved a lot of heartache by buying my meats and cheeses by the brick and slab and did my own cutting. The slicer does a wonderful job of slicing through meats and cheeses. A breeze to operate and plenty of slice thicknesses to select.
customer_reviews.author: Rickbar

customer_reviews.title: Go slow and this machine will deliver perfect, clean slices
customer_reviews.text: Love this slicer. I mainly bought it for slicing my home-baked sourdough bread and it works really well. Cutting with a knife I usually produce door-stop size bread slices. With this slicer I have thin, evenly cut bread slices that toast up to crispy goodness. You have to feed the loaf through at a slow pace, but the blade cuts very well and the whole machine works quietly and smoothly. With bread-slicing there is little clean-up anyway, and the clear plastic tray that comes with the slicer catches all the crumbs.
customer_reviews.author: Eleonore Pieper

customer_reviews.title: broke after 1 year and half
customer_reviews.text: For 1 year it was a good product, working well and cutting regular, dry ham with no issue. But is stopped working after 1 year and half (just after the 1 year warranty of course!)... for this price I was expecting a product which can last in time ...
customer_reviews.author: alexthebobo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent slicer, but get fuses
customer_reviews.text: I am on a low sodium diet, and so cannot eat most of the meat at the deli. But I can cook my own roast beef, and with this Chef's Choice 615A slicer, I am my own deli. It also works great on homemade bread, which I make without salt. But you do need to be aware that when the motor stalls (like when I tried frozen bread) the fuse will blow, and you'll think that your slicer is broken. Just pop in one of these inexpensive fuses, and you are good to go .Littelfuse/BUSSMANN GDC 1.25A (GDC-1.25A) 250v Slow-Blow Glass Fuses, T1.25A 1.25 amp, Pack of 5 These are sold on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Hedman

customer_reviews.title: A really great slicer
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this slicer. My experience has been that Chef's Choice makes good kitchen gear, and this certainly has been the case with this slicer. It's very well designed and well manufactured, and there's no cheap feel to it. It's very solid and doesn't move around at all on the counter. It's simple to adjust the thickness of the cut, and I've found that the basic blade that comes with it can handle normal cuts as well as shaving leftover steak. It also is designed with safety in mind. It's simple to take apart for cleaning, which usually takes me 5-10 minutes. I have found nothing that disappoints me about it.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Marty

customer_reviews.title: Great slicer for home use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great slicer. There are things that need to be aware of. First, buy the noon serrated blade. Depending on what you're slicing you'll end up using both. If you're slicing something like cheese make sure you put it in the freezer for 15 to 20 minutes to get it real cold otherwise the cheese softens too much and binds the blade. It's a great slicer. Easy to clean and for home use it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: MWP71467

customer_reviews.title: Home cooking game changer.
customer_reviews.text: This product is a game changer for prepping for food. We use it to make all different cuts of meat to cook with. Cheeses teams, shabu Shane, hot pot, pork belly slices for bacon! Everything you can imagine. It even cuts well from frozen as well! Would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Primelife

customer_reviews.title: Close enough to pro w/o the pro cost.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy enough to look professional and small enough to make home use less of a chore. Not hard to clean, but definitely not as easy as limited or part time user would like. This thing never bogged down or overheated. Buy a high quality lube for the gears. This unit does not come with any. I also recommend that this sit in a tray to catch any juices from meats or other items you slice up.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Waited too long to buy it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great slicer. I've used it for corned beef, turkey breast, tri-tip roast and a loaf of cheese with excellent results. I can slice corned beef on the lowest setting, and get extra thin slices. when using it to slice cheese, you have to go a little slower than with meat, or it will bog down and possibly blow the fuse. That's because of the low fat content with cheese. it's easy to remove the blade for cleaning, and other parts can be easily removed. When not in use, you can lock the blade in place.
customer_reviews.author: Le Chef

customer_reviews.title: Jerky fast
customer_reviews.text: I make a lot of jerkey for both myself and my hounds. This machine zips right through everything I pass through it and it is easy to take apart, clean and put back together again. You might want a more powerful motor but as long as you aren't passing super frozen meat through it this is fine at a reasonable price. I like it a lot and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: hhilde

customer_reviews.title: Broke already
customer_reviews.text: did give a great review but now I can’t put less then 1 star! I received it April 18 so hasn’t even been 2 months and it just stopped working! I paid a lot for this and maybe used it 5-6 times
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Sawyers

customer_reviews.title: Very good slicer!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall the Chefs Choice is a great slicer! Always use caution with sharp objects.. This is no exception! It comes with a serrated blade, the straight blade is extra so I bought it. The motor is strong but I wish the revolutions were faster for that clean cut. Overall, this was a great bargain on sale!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Griese

customer_reviews.title: Awesome slicer!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for Christmas. We've used it for everything from roast beef to fresh bread. The thickness range is great. Wonderful value.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Shehata

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: The product was just as described, with a shop/ship worn box, showing evidence of several removed labels plus other signs of a rough past. However, when opened, the meat slicer was in perfect condition with all packing components in place and the slicer, with its extra parts, all appear to be new. It works as advertised, so I'm a satisfied customer. If something unexpected occurs, I will deal with the supplier then and report the experience, if necessary, at that time.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: even cut slices
customer_reviews.text: If you like even cut slices, if you enjoy thin slices even shaved slices, this is not for you. The problem once you set the thickness gauge it expands. I mostly cut Deli ham and turkey nothing too difficult. Don't bother with Chef'sChoice customer service, they do not answer the phone even when a message is left and by no memes do they reply to the email. Don't waste your time on these folks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really thin cuts!
customer_reviews.text: I bought another, cheaper meat slicer for slicing beef carpaccio and regretted it. Then I tossed the cheaper slicer and bought the Chef's Choice based on Amazon reviews. No regrets! It slices wafer thin, just like in restaurants.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Smith

customer_reviews.title: The grey looks kinda green
customer_reviews.text: I received the grey one even though I ordered stainless steal. The grey one is more of a green color. The blade is smaller than I thought. I ended up returning.
customer_reviews.author: A Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works great for us
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheap one for years. I ordered this one and sent the other to the trash. I can cut very thin slices with ease. I also cut about frozen chicken breast thin with no problem. The chicken is for the dogs treats from the dehydrator. Beef jerky cuts were perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: BMB

customer_reviews.title: Great Slicer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to dial a thickness while serrated blade does the work. Good cast iron heavy base. Remove cutting blade lock counterclockwise for ease of cleaning. Sliding tray can be removed for cleaning. Unit has a tray under the unit that catches your slices. ( tray made of plastic) Cut 4 Tri Tip roasts for small sandwiches within minutes with no issues. All cuts looked professional. Haven't found any negatives yet. Good unit for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a full size meat slicer, I like this one better, light weight, has enough power and for home use its awesome, I process a lot of meat and so far it has not let me down, however I don't cut bones, the width adjustment is great, and it pushes the meat the into the collection tray much better then the $600 dollar pro slicer I no longer use, I would buy this again in a second even if it only lasted a year, I give it a 10
customer_reviews.author: john ceresnak

customer_reviews.title: Meat must be almost frozen to cut clean
customer_reviews.text: When cutting simi-frozen meat it still leaves a section uncut. You end up with a "lip" of uncut and must turn meat over to keep the "lip" edge from getting larger. If meat is just about frozen solid then it cuts great. Slow to cut frozen but it has the power to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Food Slicer
customer_reviews.text: I like the way this slicer works, it does a very good job and is easy to use. I don't like the lack of sufficient size suction cup feet. They are small and don't keep the slicer from moving while using which can be dangerous if you're not careful. I wish it also came with a smooth blade which I had to purchase separately. I find the smooth blade does a better job on cutting meat better, I also use it to slice homemade bread.
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE ORKOFSKY

customer_reviews.title: Not able to cut clean slices
customer_reviews.text: My first voyage with this machine was to slice London broil for jerky. The blade barely slowed with the cutting but it did not cut totally clean. It left a flat piece of meat at the bottom of the pre-sliced London broil. In addition, I had to reset the meat before each cut because the blade pushed the meat up and out of alignment. Perhaps I am doing something wrong but the direction were followed to the letter.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Cathcart

customer_reviews.title: blade does not spin
customer_reviews.text: purchased this 3 months ago- finally had enough family able to visit since quarantine and was looking forward to having nicely sliced roast beef......the blade does not spin! I have taken it apart and put back together multiple times with no luck. When the blade is removed the inside small cog spins fine, but I guess its not engaging with large cog on blade I like the design & look of it, but no good to me if the blade can't cut the meat
customer_reviews.author: Kathie Napoliton

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: A great machine stay sharp cuts good it is better to spend a few more dollars for a slicer then not this is the one that we use all the time for it will hold up not like the cheap ones that break down in a few weeks
customer_reviews.author: corvette teddy

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel is not stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: The product I received was not what was in the picture. I ordered the meat slicer in stainless steel and what I received was clearly not the right color. It was kind of a gray color mixed with avocado green. I gave them a second chance, returned and re-ordered it in stainless steel with the same results. Obviously someone at the manufacturer does not know their colors at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great home produxt
customer_reviews.text: This is the most outrageous piece of equipment. I made my first slice through semi frozen steak for jerky and didn't even know it had cut it. I haven't been this excited about a new piece of equipment since I bought my first Harley. Well done Chef's Choice.
customer_reviews.author: WCuster

customer_reviews.title: "Used - Very Good" condition item arrived in unsealed box, missing parts and broken.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a used version in "very good" condition. Item arrived in an unsealed box - no tape or anything to hold the box shut. Item had old food residue, had a rusted piece, the blade adjustment dial did not work, and was missing the locking mechanism on the slider, so the slider did not stay in place. Completely unsafe and not a "very good" condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate.
customer_reviews.text: This slicer works so smooth and easy! Perfect meat slices, easy to take apart to clean. Even my husband enjoyed using it. We’re both VERY IMPRESSED. WE Love it!! We used artist paint brush to clean crevices.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working, wrong instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after being used only twice. I suspect it is a fuse problem. The instruction booklet says that a fuse was included, but there was none in the package. Furthermore, the telephone listed in the booklet, 800-342-3255 "cannot be reached" according to Verizon. I wish I have never fallen in the trap of buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love My Slicer
customer_reviews.text: Great slicer for meats, breads and even cheeses & veggies. Lots of width options, but no slant cuts. A bit difficult to use when item to be cut is less than 2 inches wide. Cleaning gets more complicated if you need to remove the blade. The locked closed feature is great for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Allan M.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this slicer
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this slicer and am very satisfied with the quality and design of the unit. It is a one piece cast aluminum base and is designed so that you can have a plate or tray to catch whatever you are slicing. Other slicers are either made of plastic or do not have a good design for use. It is a little noisy but for the money I would certainly recommend this slicer.
customer_reviews.author: GregHallentown

customer_reviews.title: We used it twice and then it broke!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife for Christmas. We used it twice and then the gear broke. We only had about two weeks before the return policy expired, well we had only used it once during that time. Next time we used it... no good. Very disappointed with this product and company! Do NOT buy
customer_reviews.author: Brian Park

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit for the money. Great for occasional use in the home.
customer_reviews.text: Cut smooth nice even slices. I bought the smooth blade as well for deli thin cuts,worked very well,not all units offer this option. Time will tell longevity. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the buy. We use it way more than we thought. So easy to use and is perfect for entertaining. We now cut loaves of bread, lunch meat, vegetables sliced. Makes eating Whole Foods and healthy so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: NHerlihy

customer_reviews.title: Excllent Slicer
customer_reviews.text: This slicer is very easy to use, does an excellent job slicing meat and cheese, and is easy to adjust the thickness of the slices. It's a bit challenging to clean, but overall a great slicer for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Porter

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working after just 5 months. Tried to contact customer service but the phone was never answered. Left voice message but no response either. Poor product quality and service.
customer_reviews.author: Theseus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: The slicer is very well made and is an attractive machine. My wife likes paper-thin slices of ham and the machine delivers perfectly. Not hard to clean but as all the warnings say, watch what you are doing and be very careful around the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph H.

customer_reviews.title: Great meat and cheese slicer
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. I make a lot of homemade meats like pepperoni and jerky. My wife makes a lot of cheese. This is super effective at cutting both however thick you want. Cleaning isn't bad at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kodie

customer_reviews.title: Great product make sure they send you the right slicer!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift so I was really PO'd to see that they didn't send me the stainless steel that I ordered but with that being said the recipriante loves it! Prime rib sliced for French dip was a big hit.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppie Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: The product is great My only complaint is the packaging was terrible and I am talking about the entire box. If it wasn't for all the foam it would have been damaged. I purchase new and I love decent packaging. Disappointed with that.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Graham

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: So far not very noisy. it works better if the meat is frozen. Price is very reasonable and my mom loves it.
customer_reviews.author: joyce jj

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Slicer But Dlvd Cracked
customer_reviews.text: Love this slicer, best one I've ever had. Does it's job perfectly. Bought the straight blade for extremely thin slices. The only complaint I have is that the front corner was cracked. No damage to the boss so someone at Chefs Choice packed it broken. I am keeping it because it works well, but disappointed that it is cracked.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Best slicer for home use!!
customer_reviews.text: So thrilled with this. It appears to be perfect for home use. Good quality and the small brochure is very helpful
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made slicer and easy to clean or service
customer_reviews.text: Found this product to be as described with the look and feel of a much more costly commercial slicer. I am happy with the slice size of lunch meat (sandwich) preparation. It’s perfect for my not so frequent use requirements so it should perform well for years. I did get the knife edge blade which gives a nice finished product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t survive five minutes after unboxing!
customer_reviews.text: This unit broke just five minutes after unboxing for the first time. The drive gear collar snapped off the motor chassis casting. The unit is irreparable. Brand new. Broke after the arduous task of slicing cheese! Buy at your peril.
customer_reviews.author: John Harcourt

customer_reviews.title: Best slicer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Works really good, Just as good as the big ones used in butcher shops.
customer_reviews.author: Copboots

customer_reviews.title: Compaired to more expensive, this purchase was a no brainer
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this slicer, it cuts like a breeze, whatever you slice. Quality in every detail... I would recommend to everyone seeking a good home slicer...Worth the money, since they put quality in building it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great sandwich meat!
customer_reviews.text: Came quick and in great condition, Used it to cut Turkey, Ham, Beef, and Cheese for my daughters grad Party, The only thing that didn't work that great was the platter that I had to set a little deeper to catch the slices. Cleaned up in 5 minutes talking the blade off and washing the machine between different meats and cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Cronkhite

customer_reviews.title: I would purchase this product again
customer_reviews.text: I was quite surprised at how well this worked. We raise our own meat so do a lot of slicing. My only recommendation is meat slices better when frozen but that goes for most slicers
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home use
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I buy bulk salami that is hard to find. I needed something to slice it and this seemed to have good ratings. It’s not commercial grade by any means, but it works fantastic on this hard salami. Even, quick cuts. Easy to clean. I stayed with the serrated blade and it’s just fine. I’d totally recommend this for lighter duty home use!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: The Easy Bake Oven of Slicers
customer_reviews.text: Nice toy, useless as an actual slicer. It blew a fuse on the first slice of ham. The replacement fuse lasted a full 30 seconds. Great to know that Chef's Choice has joined the rest of the world in manufacturing and selling garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Nading

customer_reviews.title: Meat slicer
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what I'd make better. This is my first go round.. but it worked just fine
customer_reviews.author: Terry1022

customer_reviews.title: Good home slicer.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to slice a bottom round roast for beef dip sandwiches. Sliced it very thin and evenly.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Nice little slicer!!
customer_reviews.text: This slicer is awesome! It slices anything you can think of. I've used it for chicken, beef, ham, cheese, sausage, onions, and more. It has not disappointed. It is relatively quiet, powerful, and I love that it has a button that keeps the blade moving without having to hold the button.
customer_reviews.author: gsdlady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Affordable Product
customer_reviews.text: I cut my own Tri-Tip for Carne Asada. This slicer quickly cuts through 5lbs of meat with the serrated blade. I believe the serrated blade is the key. I totally recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Valie Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Easy to use and clean. Nice quality!
customer_reviews.author: daxiong

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about paying this much for a slicer to use at home, but I think I'm glad I did. The blade is VERY sharp, sliced excellently, and was very easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Celia Kay Aaron

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: great value. not for commercial use but perfect for home smoker meals (brisket, turkey etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Wakschal

customer_reviews.title: Not Stainess Steel
customer_reviews.text: item description is very misleading. It makes no sense to pay more money for stainless steel because you will never get one. I sent mine back for a stainless steel replacement only to get one painted seafoam green. both units were shipped this way. machine slices well but is a little difficult to clean compared to others. If you want a better description see Williams Sonoma website
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for your money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great slicer, heavy duty body, quiet, efficient, easy to use and clean. I would recommend this to my family & friends.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Romano

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great product. A little pricey but well worth the money. The cheap slicers are not to recommend even if you rarely cut meat or bread. This product works great!
customer_reviews.author: Niels Berg

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Although I don't have use it for too long it is ok for the price you pay. It cuts nicely and you can adjust the cut easily. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Ml Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used it to slice ham, cheese, and vegetables and have found it to be very easy to use, got accurate and consistent slice for each item and am quite happy with it. I believe that long term it will be a time, effort, and money saver. I highly recommend this slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Al Steele

customer_reviews.title: Slicer is Great
customer_reviews.text: I use this slicer to slice cheese and summer sausages. All slices are all the same sizes instead of being thick and thin when I used a knife. Great appliance and glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: James Sands Sr

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Easy to use. Did blow out the fuse on 2nd use, but it was easy to replace and came with a spare.
customer_reviews.author: michael p vega

customer_reviews.title: Slices through semi frozen meat like butter..
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a slicer that would slice semi frozen chicken breast to dehydrate for my dogs and it works fantastic. I would recommend this slicer as being as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Pirrotta

customer_reviews.title: they don't last
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these in less than a year, and both of them have stopped working on me. The second one just stopped slicing mid-loaf...and I have no back-up. I cannot finish my bread order and deliver today. I won't be buying this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy E. Holden

customer_reviews.title: Very sad
customer_reviews.text: I used slicer for two days and the fuse kept blowing when I tried to slice cheese
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp blade, nice thickness control. Slightly noisier that the one replaced, and it takes up more counter space. But, happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this for any serious cutting
customer_reviews.text: If your planing on slicing vegetables and fruits for pickling/drying this would probably suffice but it can barely go through frozen or even semi frozen meat and the cleaning is just disastrous.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Money saver
customer_reviews.text: I use to slice meat for sandwiches. I cook my own meats and slice, instead of buying cold cuts at a deli. Saves money and I mostly know what’s in the meat
customer_reviews.author: captaintom

customer_reviews.title: Great value and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Im in love. Omg I didn't know turkey could taste so fresh!! It's actually moist. We love it for cheeses too
customer_reviews.author: Bexxy

customer_reviews.title: Bought it as a gift and he loves it
customer_reviews.text: My stepdad did a lot of review hunting for a middle of the road slicer. He loves to cook and this was perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Use it to slice home-smoked bacon. Works excellent. Make sure to chill the bacon prior to slicing and slice with the fat pad facing up. Great slicer for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Lally

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this slicer! No more store bought modified lunch meat! Easy to set how thick of a cut you want, and slices pretty much anything.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: The light weight small design works for my household needs. Fits in my cabinets. Cleans up easily. Slices really thin.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Brown

product_meta.title: Chef'sChoice Electric Meat Slicer with Stainless Steel Blade Features Slice Thickness Control and Tilted Food Carriage Easy Clean, 7-Inch, Silver
product_meta.description: Color:SilverChef'schoice electric food slicer 609T 609 is rugged and powerful. It features a tilted food carriage design for fast and efficient slicing. The multi-purpose 7-inch stainless steel blade slices a wide variety of foods and the large Capacity food carriage retracts fully to permit slicing of extra large roasts, hams and other foods. Its "easy-clean" design features a removable blade, food carriage, food pusher and food deflector for quick and easy cleaning. Constructed with key components made of cast aluminum and stainless steel, the unit houses a powerful, cool running, high torque motor and features reliable, smooth, gear drive operation. It features precision thickness control for slicing a wide variety of foods including meat, vegetables, breads and cheese from deli-thin to 3/4-inch thick with a click of a safety button the food carriage can be secured in a "lock" position to limit access to blade when unit is not in use. Serving tray included.
feature_bullets: Cast-aluminum and stainless steel slicer with gear-drive cool-running high-torque motor
7-inch multipurpose stainless steel blade slices from deli-thin to approximately 3/4-inch slices
Tilted large-capacity food carriage and cantilever design provide fast efficient slicing
Blade food carriage food pusher food Deflector and Thickness guide remove for easy cleaning safety fuse at the base of the slicer for power surges protection
